free_resp_prompt: In the text box below, please describe any strategies you used to try and beat your opponent.
free_resp_answer: I assumed a computer opponent and thus started looking for patterns right away - there were a few clear patterns that the computer would cycle through (ex: rock --> scissor --> paper) over and over, with occasionally a few switchups (such as duplicating paper or going from paper --> rock when it should have been scissors next). After the pattern was found for that set of rounds, it was rather automatic responding. I think I did alright, though it could have been more optimized on my end as a few of the switchups made me think it was not a pattern and thus cost me more ties/losses than it should have.
